response.reasoning: "Factorss" is a misspelling; the correct plural form is "factors".
The single straight apostrophe should be a curly opening quotation mark for the quoted phrase.
"Sub-groups" is an acceptable hyphenated form, though "subgroups" (one word) is also common.
A comma before "and" would improve clarity as it separates two independent clauses.
A comma before "and" would improve the flow between the two interrogative clauses.
"With regard to" is the more standard and concise idiom than "with regards to".
"Form" is an incorrect word choice; it should be "from" or "in" to make grammatical sense.
The past participle "improved" is required after "could have been" to form the passive voice.
"Skillset" is commonly accepted as a single word, though "skill set" (two words) is also correct.
"Cross sections" is acceptable as two words, but "cross-sections" is often preferred for clarity as a compound noun.
